How difficult was it to communicate with your partner?

How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of English?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
yes
fantastic! i'm at the start, next to a twig that leads to a small island with a tiger
¿Qué camino debo tomar?
Go to the rock across the twig on tiger island
alright, i'm at the tiger island now
from here, should i head towards the butterfly or the parrot island?
parrot island
alrighty then, now i'm at the parrot island
Sólo para confirmar, ¿debería dirigirme hacia el elefante o buscar algún otro camino?
hacia el elefante. quedate en medio del parrot y elefante
awesome, done! ahora, ¿debo ir hacia las rocas, la rana o el cocodrilo?
las rocas con la rana
okay, got it! i'm now near the rocks with the frog
¿que sigue? ¿Ir al cocodrilo o al elefante?
el cocodrilo
perfect, now i’m at the big crocodile
should i head back to the elephant?
go to the elephant
ok, now i’m with the elephant
Desde aquí, ¿tengo que pasar a la jirafa o a la serpiente?
ir a la jirafa
got it! now i’m with the giraffe
what's next?
go to the snake
right! now i’m with the snake
¿Puedo dar 2 pasos hacia el este hacia el tesoro?
si
great! now i've reached the treasure
*finished*! what's next?

chat.msg: hey, estas listo?
si
perfecto
Now, from where the white dog is sitting, go to the left, passing under a wooden bench and cross a path until you reach near a flower stand. You see it?
yes i see it
super! now make a 180 degree turn on your left
Cruza el camino nuevamente y regresa hacia el perro blanco.
ok go it
great! now, head south above a branch
keep going until you spot another white dog by a red and white checked picnic mat. can you see it?
yes I made it there
¡excelente! Ahora simplemente trota sobre la colchoneta, cerca del cuenco de bayas y continúa hacia el oeste.
ok ya llege
awesome! you see that wooden branch over the river? cross it heading north
you can do it!
ok i moved
you're smashing it! now, without touching the green bush, trek around it on the right side until you reach the florist stand
¡adelante!
ok
alright, now go left. pass below the stand and head towards a bridge
you'll see two people biking there. keep heading west
passed them
nice! after the bridge, notice the two elderly people on the bench? they are reading newspapers
pasalos y muévete un poco hacia el sur
ya los pase
good job! now, move a bit to the south, between these old folks and another wooden branch
you will spot a bush at the end of the branch. can you see it?
yes
great, head east, between the branch and the bush
¡ya casi estás ahí!

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
yes im ready
perfecto! i'm at the tent up north
¿Qué camino tomar, amigo?
Go down until you reach the dirt path just past the dog
alright, passed the doggo
now, i can see the fire, mushroom, and a blue car. where to next, bud?
Go towards the fire but go over it and pass in between the  fire and mushrooms. Then stop at the path
got it, just maneuvered between the fire and the mushroom
now i'm at the path, what's up next amigo?
head towards the car but then 180 back and head down on the path
¡Ah, astuto! Hice un rápido giro de 180 grados, ahora en dirección sur por el camino.
where are you?
i see a telescope and some rocks up ahead
go to the telescope. Pass between the telescope and bush. Then stop and the bottom path
okay, navigated past the telescope, now at the path's end
what's my next move, compadre?
move west and then move slightly north towards the cabin
moved west and a bit north, got the cabin in my sights
*finalizado*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
ready
great! start by walking under the first palm tree to your southwest. after that, make a right, pass the second tree, then take a sharp left before reaching the third one
dirígete hacia el sur desde allí. ¡sigue moviendote!
ok
not too far ahead, you'll spot a brown puppy
steer left of him, then make a slight left and a right afterwards, heading south. getting the hang of this, eh?
ok
alright, up ahead you'll see a big rock on your left and a small one on your right
Ve entre ellos hacia el agua. hermoso, ¿no?
in the water
cool! now, in the water, you'll see a big, red crab
turn right near it and stay close to the big rock, heading west. watch out not to get wet!
pass the roca
awesome! keep going until you spot a medium size rock
y ¡oh, cuidado con el tiburón en el agua!
ok
you see it? great, make a sharp turn right there
almost lost my footing last time, watch your steps
next
head back to land now
Verás nuestra bola de colores extraños, azul, amarillo y blanco. ve entre ella y la roca mediana
next
now, steer a bit left and keep heading north
still going up
excellent! ahead, there's a red tent and a large speaker
navega entre ellos, en dirección noroeste. ¡Lo estás haciendo genial!
ok
now, take a slight curve around the tent, it's sorta like a mini rainbow path haha
what now?
head south towards the sea again, but don't get too eager, we're not going swimming this time!
ok next one
when you reach the shore, swerve right and pass beneath a red kayak
¡cuidado con tu cabeza!
next one
alright, swivel right 90 degrees staying near the kayak, and head straight north

general_survey.answer: I grew up in a bilingual home
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I have no problem with it as long as I can understand
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:
Any final comments about your language background?
